headline.seo: Brian Hanrahan, BBC Reporter, Dies at 61
headline.main: Brian Hanrahan, Longtime BBC Reporter, Dies at 61

docs.snippet: Mr. Hanrahan delivered perhaps his most celebrated report from an aircraft carrier during Britain’s war to reclaim the Falklands in 1982.
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Hanrahan delivered perhaps his most celebrated report from an aircraft carrier during Britain’s war to reclaim the Falklands in 1982.

docs.snippet: Lago Todos los Santos, abutting the foothills of the Andes in southern Chile, is a place shifting colors and snow-capped volcanoes.
docs.lead_paragraph: Lago Todos los Santos, abutting the foothills of the Andes in southern Chile, is a place shifting colors and snow-capped volcanoes.

headline.seo: Bahia Bustamante: Argentina’s Secret (and Private) Answer to the Galapagos
headline.main: Bahia Bustamante: Argentina’s Secret (and Private) Answer to the Galapagos

docs.snippet: In a huge, almost untouched swath of Patagonia, hundreds of species live in private bliss. A few hundred people a year can join them.
docs.lead_paragraph: In a huge, almost untouched swath of Patagonia, hundreds of species live in private bliss. A few hundred people a year can join them.

docs.abstract: Saturday Profile on James Peck, first Falklands native to obtain Argentine citizenship since the 1982 war; Peck says that he just wants to be closer to his children, but for some on the British-controlled islands, he is a traitor.

headline.seo: Father Caught in Argentina-Britain Dispute Over Falklands
headline.main: A Father From the Falklands Caught in an International Dispute
headline.print_headline: A Father Caught In a Bitter Dispute Over the Falklands

docs.snippet: James Peck, the first Falklands native to obtain Argentine citizenship since the 1982 war, just wants to be closer to his children, but for some on the islands, controlled by Britain, he’s a traitor.
docs.lead_paragraph: James Peck, the first Falklands native to obtain Argentine citizenship since the 1982 war, just wants to be closer to his children, but for some on the islands, controlled by Britain, he’s a traitor.

docs.abstract: British authorities say that their deployment of Prince William on a flight training mission in the Falkland Islands has nothing to do with the impending 30th anniversary of the Falkland War, a 1982 conflict between Argentina and Great Britain; posting is widely seen as an intentional provocation in Argentina, where British rule of the Falklands is still considered an unjust colonial holdover; dispute over the Islands has intensified in recent years, following discovery of oil and deployment of additional British troops.

headline.seo: Prince William’s Posting to Falklands Revives Ire
headline.main: Prince’s Posting in Falklands Revives Ire Before Anniversary
headline.print_headline: Prince’s Posting in Falklands Revives Ire Before Anniversary

docs.snippet: What British officials call Prince William’s routine mission is stirring interest at home and abroad as the 30th anniversary of Argentina’s invasion of the Falkland Islands approaches.
docs.lead_paragraph: What British officials call Prince William’s routine mission is stirring interest at home and abroad as the 30th anniversary of Argentina’s invasion of the Falkland Islands approaches.

docs.abstract: Pres Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner announces that Argentina will formally complain to the United Nations after Britain sent one of its most modern warships to the disputed Falkland Islands; accuses Prime Min David Cameron of Britain of militarizing their nations' dispute over sovereignty of the South Atlantic archipelago.
docs.snippet: President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner said Tuesday that Argentina would formally complain to the United Nations after Britain sent one of its most modern warships to the disputed Falkland Islands.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner said Tuesday that Argentina would formally complain to the United Nations after Britain sent one of its most modern warships to the disputed Falkland Islands.

headline.seo: Britain Rules Out Talks With Argentina Over Falklands
headline.main: Britain Rules Out Talks With Argentina Over Falklands
headline.print_headline: Britain Rules Out Talks With Argentina Over Falklands

docs.snippet: Britain on Wednesday ruled out any negotiation with Argentina over the future of the disputed Falkland Islands after President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner said she would formally complain to the United Nations.
docs.lead_paragraph: Britain on Wednesday ruled out any negotiation with Argentina over the future of the disputed Falkland Islands after President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner said she would formally complain to the United Nations.

docs.abstract: Argentina lashes out at Great Britain in an increasingly tense territorial dispute over the Falkland Islands, accusing it of deploying a nuclear-armed submarine to the South Atlantic and threatening the region's stability.

headline.seo: Argentina Says Britain Is Raising Tensions in Falklands
headline.main: Argentina Says Britain Is Raising Tensions
headline.print_headline: Argentina Says Britain Is Raising Tensions

byline.contributor: Simon Romero reported from Rio de Janeiro, and Charles Newbery from Buenos Aires.
byline.original: By SIMON ROMERO and CHARLES NEWBERY

docs.snippet: An exchange at the United Nations over what Argentina called militarization in the Falklands reflected deteriorating ties between the two nations.
docs.lead_paragraph: An exchange at the United Nations over what Argentina called militarization in the Falklands reflected deteriorating ties between the two nations.

docs.abstract: As the 30th anniversary of Britain's war to recover the Falkland Islands approaches, Argentina claims the old imperialists have sent a nuclear submarine to South Atlantic waters in a step that poses a threat to the region's security.
docs.snippet: As the 30th anniversary of Britain's war to recover the Falkland Islands approaches, Argentina claims the old imperialists have sent a nuclear submarine to South Atlantic waters in a step that poses a threat to the region's security.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON - Argentina has turned up the heat in its rekindled dispute with Britain over the Falkland Islands by accusing the perfidious British of dispatching a nuclear-powered, and possibly nuclear-armed, submarine to the South Atlantic.

docs.abstract: Amalia Lacroze de Fortabat, major Argentine art collector and philanthropist, dies at age 90.

headline.seo: Amalia de Fortabat, 90, Dies; Noted for Art and Scandal
headline.main: Amalia de Fortabat, 90, Dies; Noted for Art and Scandal
headline.print_headline: Amalia de Fortabat, 90, Dies; Noted for Art and Scandal

docs.snippet: Mrs. Fortabat married a cement tycoon, expanded his empire after his death and became an art collector and philanthropist as well as the richest woman in Argentina.
docs.lead_paragraph: Mrs. Fortabat married a cement tycoon, expanded his empire after his death and became an art collector and philanthropist as well as the richest woman in Argentina.
